fields.content:
The Pilgrim Mothers are a five-piece musical collective from the South Coast of England, where the waves crash and the seabirds fly. We make vintage, rootsy, folky, soulful sounds and play brand new original songs about life, love and longing - as well as eclectic covers including songs by Tom Waits, Van Morrison, vintage gospel, blues and wartime tunes. Celebrating the past, singing for a better now. 

"As if the English invented Americana." 
The Independent on Sunday
fields.excerpt: 20.30.  Free entry
fields.title: The Pilgrim Mothers

fields.content: Stormy-T and Bluesman’s Lane are a four piece Hastings based Blues Band, playing traditional rhythm and blues, swing, blues and funk from the 1930’s to the 2000s.  The Band was formed in 2018 due to a mutual love of the more traditional blues & swing music, and since playing their first gig in July of 2018 have built up a big following and reputation for getting their audiences singing and dancing!
fields.excerpt: 20.30. Free entry
fields.title: Stormy T and Bluesman's Lane

fields.content: Coffee and catch up for over 50’s – a chance to enjoy a cuppa and a catch up.

fields.title: Ukulele Army

fields.content:
'Ringing the Devil’s Doorbell' is the third in a series of monologues
exploring characters from Twelfth Night and will next year be
incorporated into one show to be called ‘The Twelfth Night Trilogy’
(though will also remain as a separate solo play). The Devil’s
Doorbell sees Viola confronting issues of identity, sexuality and
hidden agendas in a world of masks and disguises. It opens with
Viola in the aftermath of the destruction of the club Jo Jo. The play
contains live music from actress and accomplished accordion
player Hannah Harris, with songs by Jacques Brel.
fields.excerpt:
Tickets: £14, Concession £11, Child £8
Plus Booking Fee
fields.title: Ringing the Devil's Doorbell

If you are a parent/carer looking after a child who is struggling with their mental health why not pop in and meet other parents. 

Relaxed group offering a safe, confidential space; time to chat, connect and share with one another. Know that you are not alone as a parent.

fields.content:
A monthly meet up run by Steve Nicolson, film actor. Your chance to watch classic movies with discussion time afterwards . 
‘If you love classic movies then let me share with you my love of old films  by showing you some of my favourites’
fields.excerpt:
12.15-2.45pm
£6 - Ticket price includes popcorn
fields.title: Film Club

fields.content:
Marky was born and raised in Poole, Dorset. He started teaching himself piano at 14.  By 18, whilst studying at The London College of Music, he was working as a resident piano player in bars and clubs. Taking requests and heckles. It's here he developed his flair for entertaining and an ability to connect with audiences and get them singing
Marky is a charismatic showman with a huge voice - which can cover musical theatre, jazz and rock- alongside piano chops which could make Jerry Lee Lewis blush.  Remarkyble.
fields.excerpt: 20.30.  Free entry
fields.title: Marky Dawson
